name: Lovage
headline: Smart, virtual receptionists for local businesses.
description: Lovage creates automated, virtual receptionists for businesses that can handle almost any customer need over the phone, via text, or on social media. Instead of hiring someone or having to deal with interruptions while working, Lovage helps your customers by answering questions, booking appointments, and more - just like you would.

founders.name: Austin Petersen, Founder
founders.description: Austin Petersen is the co-founder and Chief Executive Officer of Lovage.  Austin leads Lovage in sales and product strategy initiatives.  Previously he has held positions in business development and software engineering throughout his time attending Brigham Young University in Provo, Utah.  Austin previously studied Mandarin Chinese and Mathematics at Brigham Young University.

founders.name: Robert Hinckley, Founder
founders.description: Robert Hinckley is the co-founder and co-CTO of Lovage. Robert leads full-stack development at Lovage and builds and designs the cloud infrastructure, onboarding pipeline, dashboard, and mobile application products of Lovage’s tech stack. Previously, Robert ran a custom software consulting company with Lovage’s co-founder Alex Steffen and studied Computer Science at Brigham Young University. He grew up in Idaho and learned to speak Mandarin while volunteering with Lovage’s co-founders.

founders.name: Alexander Steffen, Founder
founders.description: Alexander Steffen is the co-founder and Co-CTO of Lovage Labs. Alexander leads software development and design for all of Lovage’s phone products and cloud services. Previously Alexander was studying Electrical Engineering and researching Electro-Holography at Brigham Young University in Provo, Utah. Before working at Lovage Alexander started a software consulting company with Robert Hinckley called OmniTech.

generated_description:
Welcome to Lovage, where the future of customer interaction is getting a whole lot smarter. Founded in 2020 and part of Y Combinator's Batch W22, Lovage is all about creating automated, virtual receptionists for local businesses, allowing them to engage with customers over the phone, text, and social media without the typical interruptions that come from hiring a human receptionist. This is particularly useful for small businesses that need assistance in managing customer inquiries, booking appointments, and enhancing overall efficiency.

Headquartered in Lehi, Utah, Lovage is a lean team of seven dedicated minds, helmed by Group Partner Michael Seibel. The company operates in the fast-evolving world of artificial intelligence and SaaS, with a keen focus on B2B productivity, aiming to make marketing and customer service more streamlined and effective.

So, what exactly does Lovage offer? Their AI-powered services simplify Google marketing for local businesses, helping them rank higher and gain visibility. The feature set includes Google My Business (GMB) optimization, AI-assisted Google Ads management, regular posts to GMB, and tools for gathering reviews through NFC technology. All of this is designed to drive new customers to businesses while saving time and reducing the hassle of traditional marketing methods.

Pricing is straightforward and accessible at $500 per location per month, with a no-fine-print money-back guarantee if you don't see results. Lovage stands out due to its commitment to ROI-driven strategies, proactive support, and a customer-first philosophy that emphasizes transparency and simplicity—qualities that can be hard to find in traditional marketing agencies.

To get started, it takes just a few minutes to sign up on their website [getlovage.com](https://getlovage.com). Join the growing number of local businesses benefiting from Lovage’s innovative approach to customer interaction and marketing.

If you’re curious about taking your customer service and marketing to the next level with AI, Lovage is designed to help you realize that potential—effortlessly and effectively.
